# FRONTEND RECRUITMENT DELIVERY v0.1

[![forthebadge](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://forthebadge.com)

[![forthebadge](https://forthebadge.com/images/badges/built-with-love.svg)](https://forthebadge.com)

This project was bootstrapped with the ejected version of [Create React App](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app).

## About the project

This project was build upon the requirements stablished on the [document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qpQDsO03DT9TIqg4oFqtrokr4gXkHF4dlrHgOEXRQ9w/edit#heading=h.t3y2ujavvcjh) provided by Bliss Applications, and it was build upon 3 different routes: <br />
[Question list](./src/views/question-list): View that contains the list with the questions provided by the API <br />
[Details](./src/views/details): View with the specific details of the question selected <br />
[Not Found](./src/views/not-found): The user will be redirected if he tries to enter on a unavailable page <br />

To accomplish the FREQ-04 requirement, it was built a [modal](./src/components/share-modal) that will hit the endpoint to send emails with the current URL to different emails. <br />

The approach made to fill the FREQ-05 requirement was to check if the user has or not an internet connection and if not block the interaction by showing the [NoConnectivity](./src/components/no-connectivity) component. <br />

The only way to access the application will be if the health check verification is fulfilled, otherwise, the user won't be able to do anything on the website created. All the logic with the health-check and the connectivity can be found [here](./src/views/app)

For data manipulation, the react-redux library was used, along with redux-thunk, redux-logger, redux-promise-middleware, redux-define, and redux-devtools-extension to be able to see the status of the application with this [extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/redux-devtools/lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd?hl=pt-BR). To deal with the SPA application, the library @reach/router was chosen to deal with the data.

## Requirements

This project was carried out with Reactv17 using node v14.17

To run it is necessary to have node and yarn installed on your computer.

## How To Run the Application

```bash
# Clone this repository
$ git clone https://github.com/marinastavares/marina-tavares-bliss

# Go into the repository
$ cd marina-tavares-bliss

# Install dependencies
$ yarn

# Run the app
$ yarn start
```

## Run production build

```bash
# Clone this repository
$ git clone https://github.com/marinastavares/marina-tavares-bliss

# Go into the repository
$ cd marina-tavares-bliss

# Install dependencies
$ yarn

# Build the app
$ yarn build

# Serve the app (If the serve is installed)
$ serve -s build
```

## Production link

[https://marina-tavares-bliss.netlify.app/](https://marina-tavares-bliss.netlify.app/)
